metadata.title: Speaking with the Osage Elder
metadata.description: Wisdom and hints from the Osage Elder

start.speaker: Osage Elder
start.text: You carry questions in your eyes, young one. Ask, and perhaps the spirits will answer through me.

choices.text: Did the Spanish really explore this land?
Is there really marble in that cave?
Have you seen my uncle, Cornelius Buckley?
I don't know what to do next.

cave_wisdom.speaker: Osage Elder
cave_wisdom.text: My people called it the Devil's Den. Not because evil dwelled there, but because men who entered often lost themselves to greed.

cave_warning.speaker: Osage Elder
cave_warning.text: The cave takes what you bring to it. Bring fear, find danger. Bring greed, find ruin. Bring wisdom, find truth.

spanish_history.speaker: Osage Elder
spanish_history.text: The bearded men came centuries ago. They sought gold and found darkness. They left a ladder and bones, nothing more.

spanish_fate.speaker: Osage Elder
spanish_fate.text: Greed. They fought over something they found — or thought they found. The cave kept their secrets, and their bones. It keeps secrets still.

marble_truth.speaker: Osage Elder
marble_truth.text: Marble? The stone that sculptors prize?

marble_answer.speaker: Osage Elder
marble_answer.text: There is no marble in that cave. Only limestone, formed by ancient seas. The white man sees what he wants to see, calls it what he wants to call it.

marble_hint.speaker: Osage Elder
marble_hint.text: If you seek proof, let the rock speak for itself. A hammer and a learned eye can tell limestone from marble as easily as day from night.

about_cornelius.speaker: Osage Elder
about_cornelius.text: The curious one with many questions and restless eyes? Yes. He came to me seeking the same truths you seek.

cornelius_fate.speaker: Osage Elder
cornelius_fate.text: He learned too much, too quickly. The cave has him now. But not forever — nothing is forever. Follow the water, and you may yet find him.

provide_hint.speaker: Osage Elder
provide_hint.text: The spirits show me glimpses of your path...

dynamic_hint.speaker: Osage Elder
dynamic_hint.text: Seek the truth in stone. The con man's lies can be proven false, but only with evidence from the earth itself. The assay office holds tools and records.

hint_followup.speaker: Osage Elder
hint_followup.text: Three threads you must follow: expose the lie, secure the rights, win the people. All three must be woven together.

farewell.speaker: Osage Elder
farewell.text: May you find what you seek without losing what you have.
